frameDefinitions: This frame contains nouns denoting Aggregates of Individuals.

An Agent causes a Theme to move with respect to a certain Fixed_location, generally with a certain Periodicity, without undergoing unbounded translational motion or significant alteration of configuration/shape.
An Agent enacts an Action that is intended to be performed again at one or more later Occasions.
A Theme moves with respect to a Fixed_location, generally with a certain Periodicity, without undergoing unbounded translational motion or significant alteration of configuration/shape.
Some entity (Theme) starts out in one place (Source) and ends up in some other place (Goal), having covered some space between the two (Path).
This frame concerns  words that express an Object's position on a scale, its Measurement, with respect to some attribute, its Dimension.
frameExamples: An <t><fex name='Agg'>army</fex></t> of postal workers descended on my office.
I <t>practiced</t> my song for the play.
That kite you see just to the right of his head was <t>moving</t> around pretty fast but the camera seemed to catch it ok.
listRoleDefinitions: This role identifies the people or things that form  the <fen>Aggregate</fen>.
This role identifies the collection of entities that are the <fen>Aggregate</fen>.
<fen>Theme</fen> identifies the object involved in motion.
The <fen>Agent</fen> performs the intentional act.
This role identifies the part of the Agent's body being used to manipulate the <fen>Theme</fen>.
<fen>Cause</fen> identifies the non-agentive force that causes the motion in place.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the event occurs.
This role  identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the event occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Action</fen> that the <fen>Agent</fen> performs intentionally in order to prepare for a later <fen>Occasion</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> performs the <fen>Action</fen> in preparation for later performances of the same type.
The later enactment or enactments that the <fen>Agent</fen> expects to perform. Note that the <fen>Agent</fen> does not have to have specific <fen>Occasion</fen>s in mind.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Agent</fen> practices.
This role identifies the place where the practicing occurs.
A physical entity that is participating in non-translational motion.
The time at which the <fen>Theme</fen> is in bounded motion.
The location where the bounded motion happens.
The <fen>Theme</fen> is the entity that changes location. Note that it is not necessarily a self-mover.
The <fen>Source</fen> is the location the <fen>Theme</fen> occupies initially before its change of location.
The <fen>Path</fen> refers to (a part of) the ground over which the <fen>Theme</fen> travels  or to a landmark by which the <fen>Theme</fen> travels.
The <fen>Goal</fen> is the location the <fen>Theme</fen> ends up in.
<fen>Area</fen> identifies the setting in which the <fen>Theme</fen>'s movement takes place without a specified <fen>Path</fen>.
<fen>Distance</fen> is any expression which characterizes the extent of the Motion.

This role is used for expressions that indicate motion along a line from the deitic center towards a reference point (which may be implicit) that is neither the <fen>Goal</fen> of the posture change nor a landmark along the way of the moving part of the body.  Often <fen>Direction</fen> is defined with reference to the canonical orientation of the Protagonist, or the orientation imposed by an implicit observer.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the Motion occurs.
The <fen>Place</fen> is the general area in which a specific motion (with <fen>Source</fen>, <fen>Path</fen>, or <fen>Goal</fen>) occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Dimension</fen> which is measured.  Most LUs in this frame incorporate the <fen>Dimension</fen>.
<fen>Object</fen> identifies the item which is measured along one of its <fen>Dimension</fen>s.
<fen>Measurement</fen> identifies the extent of the <fen>Object</fen> along the specified <fen>Dimension</fen>.
listRoleExamples: A crowd <fex>of hoodlums</fex> filled the plaza.
A <fex><t>crowd</t></fex> of hoodlums filled the plaza.
Kim twirled the glass <fex>in his fingers</fex>.
Little Dieter practiced <fex>playing the piano</fex> all day.
<fex>For our brother's wedding</fex> we had to rehearse the dinner twenty times.
Our band practices <fex>on the football field</fex>.
The explosion made <fex>me</fex> move in a hurry.
The policeman moved <fex>away from the door</fex>.
Jo moved <fex>past Dad</fex> into the hall.
The car moved <fex>into the slow lane</fex>.
The twig floated atop the water <fex>for about 100 yards</fex>.
A radioactive cloud drifted across Britain <fex>after the fire at the Windscale nuclear factory</fex>.
The  new vase is 5 cm in circumference at the top.
<fex>The  new vase</fex> is 5 cm in circumference at the top.
The  new vase is <fex>5 cm</fex> in circumference at the top.
